trans-unit.source: Extends the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor"></xref> class to provide a wrapper for defining behaviors that are converted into client script.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor"></xref> class.
A string representation of the type of the client behavior to describe.
The client ID of the target control.
type or elementID is `null` or an empty string ("").
Gets the identifier for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor"></xref> instance.
The ID or a generated value, depending on the conditions described in the following table.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptComponentDescriptor.ID"></xref> property has not been set.

A generated ID that consists of the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.ElementID"></xref> property, followed by a dollar sign ($), followed by the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.Name"></xref> property.
Gets the `id` attribute of the associated element, as set in the constructor.
The client ID of the target control, as set in the constructor.
Gets the client script that implements the target control on the page.
The client script that implements the target control on the page.
Gets or sets the name of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor"></xref> instance.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.Name%2A> property has not been set, getting the property will set it to a generated value that consists of the last segment of the `type` argument that is passed to the constructor.
For example, if `type` is "System.Object", the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor.Name%2A> property defaults to "Object".
The name of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptBehaviorDescriptor"></xref> instance, if set; otherwise, a generated name.
